definition: There is no appropriate value.
All parameters associated with radioactivity in the atmosphere, including radiation counts, isotope activities and activity ratios.
Parameters describing usage of Fish Aggregating Devices (FAD) in fisheries (particularly purse seine tuna fisheries).

prefLabel: Lake and river water level parameters
definition: Parameters describing the vertical distance (height or elevation) of river or lake water from a specified point of reference to the water's surface. Rivers are defined as being upstream from the tidal limit.
Raw pH parameter output from any type of pH sensor.
Raw direct output parameters from microstructure sensors, probes or profilers that are used to determine the distribution of water body properties on a millimetric scale.
Physical, chemical or optical properties of individual solid particles.
Parameters associated with seafloor landforms and features such as bedforms, seamounts and ridges, including morphology, evolution and associated transport phenomena.
Qualitative and quantitative parameters related to the sampling activity; includes terms related to sampling effort, sampling gears, sample processing.

prefLabel: Flow cytometry parameters in water bodies
definition: Parameters derived from flow cytometry data analysis of water samples using in situ or bench-top flow cytometers.

prefLabel: Pesticide concentrations in suspended particulate material
definition: Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to kill other life forms in suspended particulate material (SPM) collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping. Only includes parameters expressed per unit mass of SPM and not per unit volume of the water column.

Measurements made at a given time of any state variable in a sample that is the subject of an experiment that will change the composition over time, such as the water sample in an incubation experiment.
Parameters that quantify or classify the physical or financial resources used in fishing activities
Parameters related to the health and conservation status of coral species and coralligenous habitats.
Parameters used to characterize and monitor biological invasion by non-native organisms.

prefLabel: Nitrate+nitrite concentration parameters in the water column
definition: Deprecated term from a misguided attempt to distinguish between NO3 and NO3+NO2 for discovery. Use parameter group NTRA instead

prefLabel: Nitrate concentration parameters in the water column
definition: Nitrate concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column. Includes nitrate+nitrite, which is often loosely referred to as nitrate.
Parameters that characterize or quantify the contents of the stomach and gut of an animal or group of animals.
Parameters identifying or quantifying zooplankton gut pigments

Parameters that quantify any attribute of a biological entity specified elsewhere in the data model and therefore do not map to the existing biologically classified P02 categories. This concept is used as a temporary grouping of parameter codes created for the SeaDataNet biological standard format.
Any quantification of the mass (e.g. carbon, nitrogen, weight) of microalgae present on hard substrate or soft sediment at the bottom of any body of fresh or salt water.

Parameters associated with the quantification of primary production by plants living on (e.g. corals, seaweed and seagrass) or in (e.g. benthic diatoms) the seabed.  Primary production is defined as the fixation of carbon dioxide into either organic or inorganic carbon by living entities and so includes photosynthesis and calcification.
A measure of the tendency of any body of fresh or salt water to either gain or lose electrons when it is subject to change by introduction of a new species.
Parameters describing the abundance and nature of microscopic particles of man-made materials and in particular microplastics present in any body of fresh or salt water.
Parameters describing the abundance and nature of debris released on coastlines.
Parameters describing the abundance and nature of microscopic particles of man-made materials and in particular microplastics present in the sediment.
Parameters describing the abundance and nature of litter data collected on the seabed.
Parameters (including geometries, labels and categorizations) relating to areas where authorities have and-or excercise specific rights or obligations.
Parameters measured by variable fluorescence instruments such as pump and probe and fast repetition rate fluorometers
Parameters describing the variety of entity types encountered in a population of living organisms

prefLabel: Zooplankton and zoobenthos development stage parameters
definition: Development stage parameters (such as proportion but excluding abundance or biomass) of zooplankton and zoobenthos. Benthic and planktonic animals have not been seggregated because there is a degree of overlap (eg shrimps).

prefLabel: Concentration of organic matter in water bodies
definition: Concentration (not 380nm light absorption) parameters for dissolved or total organic matter (includes humics, yellow matter, Gelbstoff) in any body of salt or fresh water.
Parameters quantifying the uptake rate of nitrogen from excretion products (ammonium and urea) by flora and fauna living in any body of salt or fresh water
Any parameters quantifying ionising radiation emitted by cores or samples comprising rock, sediment (including surface sediment such as fluff)
Parameters quantifying fauna and flora that indicate physical or chemical conditions in the water column such as colonisation depths and abundance of indicator species.

prefLabel: Concentration of other organic contaminants in sediment samples
definition: Concentration parameters for carbon compounds regarded as environmentally harmful in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff' that are not included in other specific categories

prefLabel: Microzooplankton taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
definition: Microzooplankton carbon biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards., but exclude morphological classifications such as 'heterotrophic flagellate'.

prefLabel: Nitrification and denitrification rates in water bodies
definition: Parameters quantifying rates associated with nitrification (oxidation of reduced nitrogen such as ammonium) and denitrification (conversion of nitrate into gaseous compounds such as nitric oxide, nitrous oxide and molecular nitrogen) processes in the water column of any body of fresh or salt water.
Parameters quantifying the capture of non-target species during commercial and non-commercial fishing trips

prefLabel: Bacteria taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
definition: Bacteria carbon biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.  Bacteria are defined as all taxa that fall into Kingdom Monera in the ITIS taxonomy, which includes cyanobacteria.

prefLabel: Fish taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the bed
definition: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chondrichthyes) ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of bed (sea, river, lake etc.) parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  Includes animals normally considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples.

prefLabel: Dissolved total and organic nitrogen concentrations in the water column
definition: Concentration of total (organic plus inorganic) or organic dissolved nitrogen per unit volume of the water column.  Grouped together as organic nitrogen frequently determined as total nitrogen.

Parameters quantifying the amount of naturally-produced organic (molecules containing carbon) compounds that are built from multiple instances of structural units (monomers) that are covalently-bonded to produce larger structures in any sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff). Includes polynucleotides (RNA and DNA), polypeptides and polysaccharides (e.g. cellulose).

prefLabel: Nutrient concentrations in sediment pore waters
definition: Nutrient (nitrate, nitrite, ammonium, phosphate, silicate and urea) concentrations in sediment pore waters

Parameters describing aspects of a geologic unit that are the result of bulk chemical, mineralogical or physical changes related to change in the physical or chemical environment.  Includes weathering, supergene alteration, hydrothermal alteration and metasomatic effects not considered metamorphic.

prefLabel: Sedimentation flux of amino acids and associated compounds in water bodies
definition: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group (including compounds such as salts and esters) sinking vertically as particles through a unit area of a water body in units time.

prefLabel: Concentration of aliphatic hydrocarbons in sediment samples
definition: Aliphatic hydrocarbon (alkane, alkene, alkyne, polycyclic aliphatics like hopane, terpenes etc.)  concentrations in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'

prefLabel: Other halocarbon concentrations in water bodies
definition: Concentrations of volatile halocarbons (compounds comprising carbon atoms covalently bonded to fluorine, chlorine, bromine or iodine atoms) other than tracers (i.e. freons/chlorofluorocarbons) and contaminants in any body of fresh or salt water.
Digital images of the seabed obtained using either still or video cameras
Parameters quantifying the accidental spillage of liquid or dry pollutants from vessels or marine industries. Parameters may include quantities of pollutant, areas affected and event duration.

prefLabel: Dissolved total or organic phosphorus concentration in the water column
definition: Concentration of total (organic plus inorganic) or organic dissolved phosphorus per unit volume of the water column. Grouped together as organic phosphorus frequently determined as total phosphorus.
Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) size and shape parameters not included under FATM.  Most commonly used for the generic term 'fish' that maps to multiple taxa.
Parameters quantifying the number of birds (Class Aves) in a survey but not expressed per unit area. Includes presence/absence indicators.

prefLabel: Inorganic silicon species concentrations in the atmosphere
definition: Concentration of inorganic silicon species (element or compounds) in any phase of the atmosphere
Parameters related to the reproduction of cetaceans (Order Cetacea)

prefLabel: Concentration of alkanamines (amines) in the water column
definition: Alkanamine concentrations in all phases of the water column
Parameters describing or quantifying the mineralogical composition of rocks and unlithified sediments.
Concentrations of proteins per unit mass or unit volume of sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff)

prefLabel: Inorganic chemical composition of sediment or rocks
definition: Parameters specifying the proportions of inorganic components (major/minor/trace elements, trace metals etc.) in sediment or rock samples.  Major elements includes the H2O+ and H2O- parameters reported by convention in oxide weight per cent geochemical major element analyses.

Concentrations of metal elements per unit weight of sediment.  Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface.

Concentrations of the elements classically regarded as major (>1% by weight as oxide: namely: Si, Ti, Al, Fe3+, Fe2+, Mg, Mn, Ca, Na, and K) plus affiliated parameters such as H2O- (adsorbed water) and H2O+ (or loss on ignition) in rocks or sediments.

prefLabel: Concentration of inorganic halogens in sediment
definition: Concentrations of halogens as elements or simple inorganic compounds (eg iodate) in sediments (anything collected by a corer including fluff

Concentration parameters for metalloid elements in sediment.  Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface. Metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry)

Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic phosphorus per unit weight of sediment.  Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface.

prefLabel: Concentration of silicon species in sediment
definition: Concentration parameters for silicon species (including opal) in sediment (anything collected by a corer including fluff)

prefLabel: Raw X-Ray fluorometer (XRF) output from sediment samples
Zooplankton taxonomy-related biomass expressed as nitrogen per unit volume of the water column
definition: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) nitrogen biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.
Parameters as logged by measuring devices, including raw counts/voltages and ADCP relative velocities

prefLabel: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in the water column
definition: PAH concentrations in all phases of the water column. This group includes concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase, but not concentrations per unit wieght of SPM.

prefLabel: Insect and earthworm taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the littoral zone
definition: Insect (Class Insecta) and earthworm (Subclass Oligochaeta) abundance per unit area of the littoral zone (between spring tide high and low water) parameters.

prefLabel: Insect and earthworm taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the bed
definition: Insect (Class Insecta) and earthworm (Subclass Oligochaeta) abundance per unit area of bed (sea, river, lake etc.) parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  Includes animals normally considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples. This parameter group has been implemented to separate predominantly freshwater taxa from predominantly marine taxa.

prefLabel: Carbon concentrations in suspended particulate material
definition: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic carbon per unit weight of suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping.

Lipids are defined as small water-insoluble biomolecules including fats, fatty acids, esters, sterols, isoprenoid compounds, etc..  Sediment is defined as material collected by a corer (including fluff).

prefLabel: Metal concentrations in sediment pore waters
definition: Concentrations of metal elements in sediment pore waters

prefLabel: Other halocarbon dynamics in water bodies
definition: Parameters relating to the rates of creation and consumption of volatile halocarbons (compounds comprising carbon atoms covalently bonded to fluorine, chlorine, bromine or iodine atoms) other than tracers (i.e. freons/chlorofluorocarbons) and contaminants in any body of fresh or salt water.

prefLabel: Plankton abundance per unit volume of the water column
definition: Used for plankton abundance parameters where no differentiation between phytoplankton, microzooplankton or zooplankton is possible
Any quantification of the number (e.g. count, abundance) of microalgae present on hard substrate or soft sediment at the bottom of any body of fresh or salt water.
Measured or stratigraphically estimated ages of secondary mineral deposits in caves. This includes stalactites, stalagmites, flowstone, and crystal growths.
Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to kill other life forms in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'.
PCB concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts
Technical parameters that provide information on how well an instrument or data acquisition system is working
Metal concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts.
Zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) biomass determined by weighing unprocessed catch samples.

prefLabel: Bacteria taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass in sediment
definition: Bacteria ash-free dry weight biomass in sediment parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  The taxa may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.  Bacteria are defined as all taxa that fall into Kingdom Monera in the ITIS taxonomy, which includes cyanobacteria.

prefLabel: Contaminant fluxes between the terrestrial and marine environment
definition: Parameters quanitifying the transfer of substances considered harmful from land to sea, including river discharge rates of contaminant species (but not freshwater discharge rates).
Concentrations of adenylates (ADP, ATP etc) per unit mass or unit volume of sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff)

prefLabel: Other fluxes between the bed and the water column
definition: Fluxes of species other than metals and nutrients between the bed (ie the sediment) and the water column sometimes termed benthic fluxes or sediment demand

prefLabel: Dissolved inorganic carbon production and respiration in the water column
definition: Parameters related to the rates of TCO2 production and consumption based on light/dark bottle incubations

Parameters describing the size, shape or physiological activity including disease and parasite infection status of cetaceans (Order Cetacea). Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

Parameters quantifying the amount of compounds that lower the surface tension of a liquid, the interfacial tension between two liquids, or that between a liquid and a solid in any body of salt or fresh water. The term surfactants includes detergents, wetting agents, emulsifiers, foaming agents and dispersants.
Includes all variants of phaeopigment (chlorophyll degradation products). Sediment is defined as any solids collected by a corer, including fluff..

prefLabel: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in sediment samples
definition: PCB concentrations in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'

prefLabel: Nitrogen concentrations in suspended particulate material
definition: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic nitrogen per unit weight of suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping.  Note that it is common practice to assume all nitrogen in SPM is organic.

prefLabel: Sedimentation flux of biological detritus in the water column
definition: Flux of biological detritus (material derived from the water column such as exuvia and faecal pellets) in the water column

prefLabel: Macroalgae generic abundance in water bodies
definition: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per litre) of macroalgae (seaweeds) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any fresh or salt water body.

prefLabel: Uptake of other nutrients in the water column
definition: Uptake of nutrients other than nitrogen species (ie phosphate and silicate) by the water column

prefLabel: Concentration of alkenones and alkenoates in the water column
definition: Concentrations of alkenones (unsaturated aliphatic ketones) and alkenoates (carboxylic acid esters) in all phases of the water column.
Parameters associated with the concentration of algae-generated toxins in either whole organisms or their constituent parts

Parameters quantifying the electrical properties of geological units in the field. Includes parameters used to determine resistivity structure for shallow sediment properties, porosities and presence of hydrocarbon (CSEM), deeper crust and mantle studies (Magnetotellurics) and ore body location (polarisation).

prefLabel: Unclassified pigment concentrations in the water column
definition: Includes all pigments that cannot be explicitly classified as chlorophylls, phaeopigments or carotenoids.  Generally, these are parameters where different pigments have been grouped together. Concentrations are expressed in terms of per unit volume or unit area of the water column.  Does not include data expressed per unit mass of SPM.

prefLabel: Concentration of inorganic halogens in water bodies
definition: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in all phases of any body of fresh or salt water

prefLabel: Concentration of other substances in biota
definition: 'Other'  (than metals or organic contaminants) substance concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts.  This is a 'bucket' grouping that may be reclassified as the dictionary developes.

prefLabel: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in suspended particulate material
definition: PCB concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc.  This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.

prefLabel: Fish taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the bed
definition: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chondrichthyes) abundance per unit area of bed (sea, river, lake etc.) parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  Includes animals normally considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples.
Parameters describing the size, shape or physiological activity including disease and parasite infection status of true seals (Phocidae), eared seals (Otariidae) and walruses (Odobenidae).

prefLabel: Excretion rate parameters in the water column
definition: Includes all parameters relating to all mechanisms of waste release except respiration.

Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to modify bodily function or diagnose, cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent disease in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'.
Parameters related to compounds containing two oxygen atoms joined by a single bond but no carbon atoms in any body of fresh or salt water.

prefLabel: Dissolved concentration parameters for other gases in the water column
definition: All concentration parameters for inorganic dissolved gases other than oxygen and the noble gases in the water column

Morphological parameters of zooplankton and zoobenthos (essentially any animal except for insects, earthworms or fish), such as size, shape and weight.  Benthic and planktonic animals have not been seggregated because there is a degree of overlap (eg shrimps).

prefLabel: Concentration of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), ethers, aldehydes and ketones in sediment
definition: Concentrations of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), ethers,aldehydes and simple (non-alkenone) ketones in unlithified sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff).

prefLabel: Concentration of alkanols (alcohols), phenols and ethers in sediment
definition: Concentration of alkanols, phenols and ethers per unit mass or unit volume of sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff)

prefLabel: Suspended particulate material grain size parameters
definition: Includes all SPM grain size measurements and derived statistics

prefLabel: Colloidal metal concentrations in the water column
definition: Concentrations of metal elements in the colloidal phase of the water column. Usually the dissolved concentration difference between conventionally filtered water and ultra-filtered water.
Chemical analyses of minerals extracted from rocks or sediment or analysed in-situ using techniques like the electron microprobe.
Parameters quantifying the  flux of thermal energy within the solid Earth or between the solid Earth and water bodies or atmosphere.

prefLabel: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in sediment samples
definition: PAH concentrations in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'

prefLabel: Phosphorus concentrations in suspended particulate material
definition: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic phosphorus per unit weight of suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping.

prefLabel: Metal fluxes between the bed and the water column
definition: Parameters quantifying the exchange of metalsbetween the bed (ie the sediment) and the water column sometimes termed benthic fluxes

prefLabel: Terrestrial detritus in the water column suspended particulate material
definition: Parameters quantifying and categorising terrestrially-derived detritus (eg dust and pollen) in the water column

prefLabel: Concentration of adenylates in the water column
definition: Concentrations of adenylates (ADP, ATP etc) in all phases of the water column
Parameters describing the effects of substances on living organisms.

prefLabel: Insect and earthworm taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the littoral zone
definition: Insect (Class Insecta) and earthworm (Subclass Oligochaeta) ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the littoral zone (between spring tide high and low water) parameters.

prefLabel: Insect and earthworm taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the bed
definition: Insect (Class Insecta) and earthworm (Subclass Oligochaeta) ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of bed (sea, river, lake etc.) parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  Includes animals normally considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples. This parameter group has been implemented to separate predominantly freshwater taxa from predominantly marine taxa.

Parameters that quantify the size, shape, age and life processes (including mortality) of shellfish (molluscs - including cephalopods - and crustaceans of interest to fisheries research and commercial fisheries).
Parameters that quantify and specify material output into the environment as a result of industrial activity

Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) count parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards. Count includes presence/absence indicators.

Parameters quantifying the mass of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes)in total or by species per unit area or per unit volume in any body of fresh or salt water expressed in any form (e.g. wet weight, dry weight, carbon, nitrogen, etc.).

prefLabel: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in suspended particulate material
definition: PAH concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc.  This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.

prefLabel: Metal concentrations in suspended particulate material
definition: Concentrations of metal elements in suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping. Deprecated as semantic overlap with MTWP.

prefLabel: Particulate metal concentrations in the water column
definition: Concentration parameters for metallic elements in the particulate phase of the water column collected by fitration, centrifugation or sediment trapping
Parameters used to encode information specifying access rights to data, usually in terms of authorised roles

prefLabel: Concentration of other organic contaminants in the water column
definition: Concentration parameters for carbon compounds regarded as environmentally harmful in solution or suspension (i.e.includes measurements in both the dissolved and particulate phases) in any body of salt or fresh water that are not included in other specific categories
Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) in both the dissolved and particulate phases of any body of fresh or salt water.

Includes all pigments that cannot be explicitly classified as chlorophylls, phaeopigments or carotenoids (usually groups of pigments). Sediment includes anything collected by a grab or corer, including the fluff layer from the top of the consolidated sediment.
Concentration parameters for metallic elements in ice and snow
Parameters that describe the degree to which sedimentary, igneous or metamorphic rocks are able to conduct heat

prefLabel: Dissolved organic carbon concentrations in sediment pore waters
definition: Concentrations of dissolved organic carbon in sediment pore waters

prefLabel: Dissolved concentration parameters for other gases in sediment pore waters
definition: All concentration parameters for inorganic dissolved gases other than oxygen and the noble gases in sediment pore water samples

prefLabel: Fish non taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column
definition: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) abundance per unit volume parameters not included under FATX.  Most commonly used for the generic term 'fish' that maps to multiple taxa.

Parameters describing the extent, intensity, timing and method of reproduction in fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) including fecundity, reproductive rates, spawning, and nursery grounds.

prefLabel: Dissolved trace metalloid and inorganic selenium concentrations in water bodies
definition: Concentration parameters for trace metalloid elements and non-organic selenium species in the dissolved phase of any body of fresh or salt water. This may include a contribution from the particulate phase if this has not been totally removed by filtration and the metalloid in question is reactive (ie detected as if it were dissolved) to the analytical technique used. Trace metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te, and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry).

prefLabel: Phaeopigment concentrations in the water column
definition: Includes all variants of phaeopigment (chlorophyll degradation products) expressed in terms of per unit volume or unit area of the water column.  Does not include data expressed per unit mass of SPM.

prefLabel: Raw temperature and/or salinity instrument output
definition: Direct output parameters from TS instruments such as thermosalinograph or CTD

prefLabel: Phycobolin pigment concentrations in the water column
definition: Concentration of phycobolin group pigments such as phycocyanin and phycoerythrin in the water column
Parameters describing the actions or reactions of birds (Class Aves), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

prefLabel: Shellfish abundance and biomass in water bodies
definition: Parameters that quantify the numbers or amount of living material of shellfish (molluscs - including cephalopods - and crustaceans of interest to fisheries research and commercial fisheries) in any body of fresh or salt water.
Parameters characterising structure in sedimentary rocks and unlithified sediment such as bedding, lamination and bioturbation.

prefLabel: Sedimentation flux of identified biota in the water column
definition: Fluxes expressed as number per unit area per unit time of any biota or remains thereof (excluding faecal pellets which are classed as SPM) downwards through the water column

Macroalgae (Rhodophycota, Chromphycota, Chlorophycota) and seagrass (Charophyta, Anthophyta) count parameters presented at the level of taxa at any level from sub-species upwards. Count includes presence/absence indicators.

prefLabel: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in suspended particulate material
definition: Concentration parameters for inorganic sulphur species in suspended particulate material (anything collected by filtration or sediment trapping).  Group does not include parameters expressing data per unit volume of the water column
Parameters quantifying the level of radioactive emissions from in-situ geologic units
Parameters relating to the elucidation of geological structure by quantifying the proportion of waves from a high energy source reflected by sub-surface layers.
Parameters relating to structure beneath sea-bed determined by the reflection of seismic energy along a single track.
Parameters relating to structure beneath sea-bed determined by the reflection of seismic energy along multiple parallel tracks.

prefLabel: Bacteria taxonomic abundance in water bodies
definition: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any body of fresh or salt water.

Parameters describing the abundance and nature of material classed as refuse introduced to the environment by activities of man that are not covered by the more specific P02 terms for micro-litter (UMLS and UMLW), beach litter (BLIT) or seafloor litter (SLIT).

prefLabel: Particulate total and organic carbon concentrations in the water column
definition: Concentrations of total and organic carbon in the particulate phase of the water column as extracted by a filtration technique. This is the particle-bound concentration per unit volume of the water column and is both a function of the SPM concentration in the water column and the concentration of carbon per unit weight of SPM.  Total and organic carbon are classed together to circumvent confusion caused by total carbon data sets labelled 'POC' on the assumption that the inorganic carbon fraction is negligible
Parameters related to the reproduction of reptiles (Class Reptilia)
Measured or stratigraphically estimated ages of lithified sediments, igneous rock or metamorphic rock.

prefLabel: Bacterial production in the water column
definition: Parameters related to bacterial production determination by measurement of dissolved organic molecule (e.g. leucine, thymidine) uptake rates
Parameters describing the causes and rate of mortality in cetaceans (Order Cetacea). Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
Parameters relating to the abundance and nature of bacteria (Kingdom Monera) infecting other biota.

prefLabel: Acoustic noise in the water column

definition: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic carbon per unit weight of sediment.  Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface.
Parameters characterising the environment in which sediments were deposited either by observation or interpretation of sedimentary rocks and unlithified sediments.
Parameters relating to the elucidation of geological structure by quantifying the refration of waves from a high energy source by sub-surface layers.
Measured parameters expressing turbulence in the water column plus parameters derived from these measurements

prefLabel: Organometallic and organometalloid species concentration parameters in sediments
definition: All organometallic and orgamometalloid compound concentration parameters (including saturations for gaseous species) in all phases of sediments (including pore waters)
Parameters quantifying the critera for and extent of sediment resuspension

prefLabel: Inorganic phosphorus species concentrations in the atmosphere
definition: Concentration of inorganic phosphorus species (element or compounds) in any phase of the atmosphere
Parameters describing the causes and rate of mortality of true seals (Phocidae), eared seals (Otariidae) and walruses (Odobenidae).
Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group in unlithified seabed material.
Raw parameters (usually membrane current and temperature) from dissolved oxygen sensors

prefLabel: Bacterial consumption in the water column
Dissolved noble gas concentration parameters in the water column
definition: All concentration parameters including saturations and statistics such as standard deviations

Parameters expressing depth (possibly as pressure) of an instrument on a suspended underwater mooring.  These are primarily collected to monitor mooring performance by quantifying knock-down and should not be regarded as instrument z co-ordinates (accurate calibration is rare) or as sea level measurements.
Parameters that describe the degree to which unlithified sediment is able to conduct heat

Parameterisations that describe climatic conditions in the past.  Includes climate indices, climate indicators and indirect measurements of climate-related phenomena such as sea level and water table depth.

Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic nitrogen per unit weight of sediment.  Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface.

prefLabel: Metal ligand parameters in the water column
definition: Parameters concerned with the complexation of metals as ligands in the water column
Parameters relating to the intensity of ultra-violet radiation in either the atmosphere or the water column

prefLabel: Concentration of alkanes in the water column
definition: Alkane concentration parameters (including saturation of gaseous species) in all phases of the water column.  Does not include parameters expressed per unit weight of SPM.
Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any soil or sediment.

prefLabel: Concentrations of biopolymers in water bodies
definition: Parameters quantifying the amount of naturally-produced organic (molecules containing carbon) compounds that are built from multiple instances of structural units (monomers) that are covalently-bonded to produce larger structures in any body of salt or fresh water. Includes polynucleotides (RNA and DNA), polypeptides and polysaccharides (e.g. cellulose).
Reduction rates of any species in sediment cores
Includes all variants of chlorophyll.  Sediment includes anything collected by a grab or corer, including the fluff layer from the top of the consolidated sediment
Parameters quantifying the volume, mass or thickness of particulate material that gathers on the seabed per unit time.

prefLabel: Macroalgae and seagrass infection and damage
definition: Parameters relating to diseases and parasites of macroalgae (Rhodophycota, Chromphycota, Chlorophycota)  and seagrass (Charophyta, Anthophyta) and damage to seagrass beds

Parameters describing the actions or reactions of cetaceans (Order Cetacea), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
Parameters describing rocks on the basis of physical characteristics such as colour, structure, mineralogy and grain size

prefLabel: Sedimentation flux quantification in the water column
definition: Parameters expressing the total sedimentation flux in terms of particle mass, volume or counts

Parameters related to the study of human interaction with the sea through the investigation of associated physical remains, be they vessels, shore side facilities, port-related structures, cargoes, human remains or submerged landscapes

prefLabel: Suspended particulate material setting velocity parameters

definition: Parameters describing the location, nature and extent of objects that pose a threat to travel on the water column such as wrecks and obstructions
Parameters quantifying the amount of groundwater in a given system such as aquifer water level and rate of flow of water through rock formations.

prefLabel: Phytoplankton generic abundance in water bodies
definition: Any enumeration (e.g. count, abundance) of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. microphytoplankton, ciliate, flagellate) in any body of fresh or salt water.

prefLabel: Concentration of alkenones and alkenoates in sediment
definition: Parameters quantifying the amount of alkenones (unsaturated aliphatic ketones) and alkenoates (carboxylic acid esters) in any unconsolidated sediment including fluff.

prefLabel: Oxygen production and respiration in the water column
definition: Parameters related to the rates of oxygen production and consumption

prefLabel: Microzooplankton taxonomy-related biovolume per unit volume of the water column
definition: Microzooplankton biovolume parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.
Parameters quantifying the extent and nature of recreational activities in coastal waters, estuaries and their margins such as beaches.

prefLabel: Zooplankton non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as protein per unit volume of the water column
definition: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) protein biomass per unit volume for entities that have not been identified by taxonomic name

prefLabel: Microzooplankton taxonomy-related biosurface area per unit volume of the water column
definition: Microzooplankton surface area per unit volume of the water column parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.

prefLabel: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in the atmosphere
definition: Parameters quantifying polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH) concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere
The identity of the parameter is not declared.  Covers cases such as internal working parameters and dummy channels.

prefLabel: Zoobenthos non taxonomy-related wet weight biomass per unit area of the bed
definition: Any zoobenthos wet weight biomass per unit area of the seabed parameters that are not included in parameter group ZWTX.
Digital images of the water column obtained using either still or video cameras
Parameters describing the actions or reactions, usually in response to the environment, of true seals (Phocidae), eared seals (Otariidae) and walruses (Odobenidae).
Parameters describing the extent, intensity, timing and method of fisheries

Lipids are defined as small water-insoluble biomolecules including fats, fatty acids, esters, sterols, isoprenoid compounds, etc..  Biota includes any type of sample originating from a living organism.

prefLabel: Concentration of other organic contaminants in biota
definition: Concentration parameters for carbon compounds regarded as environmentally harmful in either whole organisms or their constituent parts that are not included in other categories

prefLabel: Other physical and chemical properties of suspended particulate material
definition: Parameters that do not easily fit into any of the other SPM data categories.

Parameters that quantify the fecundity, reproductive rates or nature of reproduction in shellfish (molluscs - including cephalopods - and crustaceans of interest to fisheries research and commercial fisheries).
Parameters pertaining to zooplankton growth rates including biochemical proxies such as AARS activity
Parameters that describe the distribution of the degree of hotness within a body of rock or unlithified sediment.
Parameters that describe the distribution of the degree of hotness within geologic units of lithified sedimentary, igneous of metamorphic rock.
Sediment includes anything collected by a grab or corer, including the fluff layer from the top of the consolidated sediment
Output as logged from any type fluorometer.

prefLabel: Zooplankton defecation rates in the water column
definition: Faecal pellet production and gut evacuation rates
Chemical composition of zooplankton expressed in terms of mass (or molar quantity) per specimen or per unit tissue mass
Parameters quantifying the magnitude of earth movements resulting from artificial sources (such as explosions) far away from the measurement site.
Parameters that quantify the size, shape, age and life processes (including mortality) of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes).

Zoobenthos count parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards. Count includes presence/absence indicators.

prefLabel: Zooplankton non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as nitrogen per unit volume of the water column
definition: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) nitrogen biomass per unit volume parameters not included in group ZCTC.  Usually used for generic names such as 'mesozooplankton'.
Parameters that describe the the mass per unit volume of any samples of rock or unlithified sediment.
A technique for mapping the morphology of the seafloor using a sonar swath projected sideways from a towed underwater vehicle.
Parameters relating to diseases and parasites of reptiles (Class Reptilia)

prefLabel: Sedimentation flux of alkenones and alkenoates in the water column
definition: Parameters quantifying the rate of alkenones (unsaturated aliphatic ketones) and alkenoates (carboxylic acid esters) sinking as particles through any body of water.

prefLabel: Sedimentation flux of terrestrially derived material in the water column
definition: Fluxes of terrestrial biological or lithological material
Parameters related to the reproduction of birds (Class Aves)

prefLabel: Metal uptake rates in the water column
definition: Parameters relating to the uptake rates of metals from the dissolved phase into the particulate phase

prefLabel: Zoobenthos taxonomy-related wet weight biomass per unit area of the bed
definition: Zoobenthos wet weight biomass per unit area parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  Includes animals considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples.

prefLabel: Urea concentration parameters in the water column
definition: Urea concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column

prefLabel: Organometallic and organometalloid species concentration parameters in water bodies
definition: All organometallic and organometalloid compound concentration parameters (including saturations for gaseous species) in all phases of any body of fresh or salt water.
Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) in sediment, including biota-associated parameters such as isotope enrichment in foraminifera tests.
Parameters related to the distribution of true seals (Phocidae), eared seals (Otariidae) and walruses (Odobenidae)at a particular time and location, including presence/absence indicators.

prefLabel: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in sediment pore water
definition: Concentration parameters (including saturation if gaseous) for inorganic sulphur species in all phases of sediment pore waters

prefLabel: Fauna abundance per unit area of the bed
definition: Any fauna (class Animalia) abundance per unit are of sea, river or lake bed.  Broad group overlapping a number of more specific groups that should be used preferentially, but this group is provided as an alternative to one-to-many mappings.

prefLabel: Zooplankton carbon biomass per unit area of the water column
definition: Integrated zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) carbon biomass parameters
Parameters related to the infection of Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) by parasites and disease. Includes visual assesements and analytical data.
Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to modify bodily function or diagnose, cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent disease in either whole organisms or their constituent parts.
Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) from measurements on living (at the time of sampling) organisms or parts thereof.

prefLabel: Acoustic backscatter in the water column
definition: Includes all parameters covering the strength of acoustic signal return, including absolute measurements of returning signal strength as well as parameters expressed as backscatter (the proportion of transmitted signal returned)
All parameters (including concentration, saturation, turnover and fluxes) for dissolved oxygen in sediment and sediment pore waters.

Parameters quantifying the ingestion of food by zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger but excluding fish) in terms of identified biota or chemical species and the effects of nutrition on life processes such as physiology and reproduction.
Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) in both the gaseous and aerosol phases of the atmosphere.
Raw concentration parameters from a gas analyser such as a LiCor

prefLabel: Concentration of organic sulphur species in ice
definition: Concentration parameters for organic sulphur species in ice
Parameters related to the chemical composition of any kind of water sample that was frozen solid at the time of sampling or measurement
Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) in secondary mineral deposits in caves. This includes stalactites, stalagmites, flowstone, and crystal growths.

prefLabel: Zooplankton dry weight biomass per unit volume of the water column
definition: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) biomass determined by drying to constant weight.
Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per square metre) of animals living on or near the seabed designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total).
All parameters associated with coastal landforms such as beaches and dunes including morphology, evolution and associated transport phenomena

prefLabel: Dissolved amino acid concentrations in the water column
definition: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group dissolved in a body of water.
Parmeters describing the space for fluids or gases within a geologic unit comprising lithified sediments, igneous rock or metamorphic rock.

prefLabel: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in the water column
definition: PCB concentrations in all phases of the water column. This group excludes SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight).

prefLabel: Concentration of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), aldehydes and ketones in water bodies
definition: Concentrations of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), aldehydes and simple (non-alkenone) ketones in all phases of any body of fresh or salt water

prefLabel: Concentration of alkenes and alkynes in the water column
definition: Alkene and alkyne concentrations in all phases of the water column

Parameters describing the size, shape or physiological activity of bacteria, defined as Kingdom Monera (includes cyanobacteria).  Includes parameters both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to modify bodily function or diagnose, cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent disease in either solution or suspension (i.e.includes measurements in both the dissolved and particulate phases) in any body of salt or fresh water.
All parameters related to zooplankton reproduction rates

prefLabel: Phytoplankton taxonomic volume in water bodies
definition: Any parameterisation of cell volume of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any body of fresh or salt water.
Measured or stratigraphically estimated ages of marine sediments
Nitrate concentration parameters in ice. Includes nitrate+nitrite, which is often loosely referred to as nitrate.

prefLabel: Concentration of inorganic halogens in sediment pore waters
definition: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in all phases of sediment pore water

prefLabel: Raw suspended particulate material concentration sensor output
definition: Raw parameters (voltages and counts) from in-situ suspended particulate material sensors including transmissometers, nephelometers,in-situ particle sizers and ABS (including ADCP echo intensity).

prefLabel: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in biota
definition: PAH concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts
Parameters relating to the elucidation of sediment structure by quantifying the proportion of waves from a low energy source reflected by sub-surface layers.

prefLabel: Stable isotopes in ice and snow
definition: Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) in frozen precipitation (snow, hail, ice and slush), its accumulations (e.g. glaciers), sea ice and frozen fresh water.
Parameters quantifying the chemistry of terrestrial groundwater bodies such as aquifers and waters percolating through rock formations.
Concentration of any chemical species in water collected from the atmosphere.  Includes rain, snow, hail and fog but excludes cloud samples or snow accumulations on the ground.
Direct output parameters from spectophotometric or chemical in-situ nutrient analysers

prefLabel: Phytoplankton taxonomic abundance in water bodies
definition: Any enumeration (e.g. count, abundance) of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any body of fresh or salt water.

prefLabel: Trace metalloid and inorganic selenium concentrations in sediment pore water
definition: Concentration parameters for trace metalloid elements and inorganic selenium species in water occupying the space between sediment grains. Trace metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te, and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry).

prefLabel: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in ice
definition: Concentration parameters for inorganic sulphur species in ice
Parameters related to the abundance of reptiles (Class Reptilia)

prefLabel: Particulate trace metalloid and inorganic selenium concentrations in water bodies
definition: Concentration parameters for trace metalloid elements and inorganic selenium species in the particulate phase of any body of fresh or salt water collected by fitration, centrifugation or sediment trapping. Trace metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry).
Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per square metre) of animals living on or near the seabed designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus).

prefLabel: Zoobenthos taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the littoral zone
definition: Any zoobenthos abundance per unit area of the littoral zone (between spring tide high and low water) parameters that are not fish or terrestrial animals (insecta/oligochaeta)
Statistical parameters derived from wave data expressing wave properties other than height, period and direction

prefLabel: Sedimentation flux of identified biota expressed as carbon in the water column
definition: Fluxes of any biota or remains thereof (excluding faecal pellets which are classed as SPM) downwards through the water column
Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

Any quantification of the dry mass of zoobenthos (animals living on, in or near the bed of any water body). Includes animals normally considered planktonic if collected in sediment and data expressed ash-free and in terms of carbon, nitrogen etc..

prefLabel: Zoobenthos taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the littoral zone
definition: Any zoobenthos ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the littoral zone (between spring tide high and low water) parameters that are not fish or terrestrial animals (insecta/oligochaeta)

prefLabel: Zooplankton ash-free dry weight biomass per unit volume of the water column
definition: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) biomass determined by gravimetric measurement of loss on ignition
Parameters relating to the abundance, size and morphology of particle aggregates in the SPM
Parameters that express the consumption of the phytoplankton population by the microzooplankton.  Generally the results of dilution experiments on water samples screened through a 200-micron mesh.

prefLabel: Concentration of silicon species in suspended particulate material
definition: Concentration parameters for silicon species (including opal) in SPM (material gathered by filtration or sediment trapping). Only includes parameters expressed per unit mass of SPM and not per unit volume of the water column

Parameters specifying the physical dimensions of the particles comprising lithified sedimentary rocks (including expressions of shape such as aspect ratio) and statistics derived from their variation in a sample (e.g. mean, mode, sorting, skewness).
Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any soil or sediment.
Parameters quantifying the level of activity moving people or cargo from one place to another.
Parameters quantifying and describing biota take by fishing activities
Parameters quantifying the magnitude of naturally occurring low frequency earth movements such as used for earthquake seismology and natural noise studies.
Parameters relating to human built structures on the coast or offshore and their impact on the environment.

prefLabel: Bird taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of surface
definition: Bird (Class Aves) abundance per unit area (of land or sea) presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.

Parameters describing the amount in a sample of a tracer (rhodamine, SF6, 3He, etc.) that has been purposely released into  a water body to track water mass movements or quantify exchanges with the atmosphere.

prefLabel: Zooplankton taxonomy-related biomass expressed as protein per unit volume of the water column
definition: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) protein biomass per unit volume for entities that have been identified by taxonomic name

prefLabel: Geological sample magnetic, electrical and acoustic properties
definition: Any parameters quantifying the magnetic (e.g. magnetic susceptibility), electrical (e.g. resistivity) or acoustic (e.g. P-wave propogation speed) of sediment or rock cores and samples
Parameters that quantify the numbers of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) at a given location in any body of salt or fresh water.

Lipids are defined as small water-insoluble biomolecules including fats, fatty acids, esters, sterols, isoprenoid compounds, etc..  Water body includes any body of fresh or salt water. As lipids are insoluble in water the concencentrations are associated with the particulate phase.

prefLabel: Colloidal organic carbon concentration in the water column
definition: Colloidal organic carbon per unit volume of the water column.

prefLabel: Trace metalloid and inorganic selenium concentrations in biota
definition: Concentration parameters for trace metalloid elements and inorganic selenium species in either whole organisms or their constituent parts. Trace metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te, and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry).

prefLabel: Microzooplankton taxonomic abundance in water bodies
definition: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per litre) of microzooplankton (free swimming heterotrophic organisms smaller than 200um) designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus or family) in any fresh or salt water body.
Any parameters relating to molecular biology or genetics

prefLabel: Concentration of proteins in the water column
definition: Concentrations of proteins in all phases of the water column

prefLabel: Insecta taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column
definition: Insecta abundance parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.

prefLabel: Concentration of inorganic halogens in ice
definition: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in ice

prefLabel: Stable isotopes in sediment pore waters
definition: Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) in either the solute or solvent phase of sediment pore waters.
Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per square metre) of viruses in any body of fresh or salt water.

prefLabel: Insecta taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
definition: Insecta carbon biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.

prefLabel: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in sediment
definition: Concentration parameters for inorganic sulphur species in sediment (anything collected by a corer including fluff)

prefLabel: Bacteria generic abundance in water bodies
definition: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any body of fresh or salt water.

prefLabel: Dissolved organic carbon uptake and production in the water column
definition: Any parameter relating to the rate of DOC concentration change in the water column

prefLabel: Carbonate chemistry in sediment pore waters
definition: Carbonate system parameters (DIC/TCO2, pH, alkalinity, pCO2) in sediment pore waters
All parameters associated with radioactivity in any body of fresh or salt water, including radiation counts, isotope activities and activity ratios. Activities per unit mass of SPM are included.

prefLabel: Zooplankton non taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column
definition: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) abundance per unit volume parameters not included in group ZATX.  Usually used for generic names such as 'mesozooplankton'.

prefLabel: Concentration of organic matter in sediments
definition: Parameters quantifying the proportion of organic material in a soil or sediment sample

prefLabel: Carotenoid and flavenoid pigment concentrations in water bodies

definition: Parameters that quantify the level of industrial activity or industrial output
All parameters associated with radioactivity in either whole organisms or their constituent parts

prefLabel: Phytoplankton taxonomic surface area in water bodies
definition: Any parameterisation of cell surface area of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any body of fresh or salt water.

prefLabel: Microzooplankton generic abundance in water bodies
definition: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per litre) of microzooplankton (free swimming heterotrophic organisms smaller than 200um) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any fresh or salt water body.

prefLabel: Sedimentation flux of pigments in the water column
Distribution coefficients in the water column
definition: Distribution coefficients of species between the dissolved and particulate phases of the water column
Parameters that specify the number of specified members of Order Cetacea present at a particular time and location, including presence/absence indicators.

prefLabel: Sediment water content, porosity and surface area
definition: Sediment porosity (water content by volume) and water content by weight parameters
Parameterisations of the intensity and inclination of Earth's magnetic field

prefLabel: Sedimentation flux of carbohydates in the water column
Concentration of other organic contaminants in suspended particulate material
definition: 'Other' organic contaminant (substances regarded as harmful other than PCBs and PAHs) concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc.  This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.

prefLabel: Bacteria non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as protein per unit volume of the water column
Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in the water column
definition: Concentration parameters (including saturation if gaseous) for inorganic sulphur species in all phases of the water column
Parameters relating to the size, shape and form of microfossils in sediment samples

prefLabel: Organometallic species concentration parameters in biota
definition: All measurements of the quantity or mass of any organometallic compound in any living organisms or their component parts

prefLabel: Plankton biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
definition: Used for plankton carbon biomass parameters where no differentiation between phytoplankton, microzooplankton or zooplankton is possible

Parameters describing the actions or reactions of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chondrichthyes), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

prefLabel: Zooplankton and zoobenthos physiological condition parameters
definition: Parameters indicating the health of zooplankton and zoobenthos taxa, such as fecundity, egg condition, presence of parasites/diseases etc.

Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to kill other life forms in either solution or suspension (i.e.includes measurements in both the dissolved and particulate phases) in any body of salt or fresh water.

prefLabel: Zooplankton taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column
definition: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) abundance parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.
Parameters quantifying the amount of liquids (e.g. ship's ballast) or solids (e.g. dredge spoil) deposited into the water column as a result of man's activities

prefLabel: Particulate amino acid concentrations in the water column
definition: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group in solids suspended in a body of water.

Parameters quantifying the properties of rocks and sediments that are relevance to engineering such as physical strength and load-bearing capacity.  Includes the disciplines of rock mechanics and soil mechanics.

prefLabel: Nutrient fluxes between the bed and the water column
definition: Parameters quantifying the exchange of nutrients between the bed (ie the sediment) and the water column sometimes termed benthic fluxes

prefLabel: Concentration of other hydrocarbons in the water column
definition: 'Other' (not alkanes, alkenes, alkynes or PAHs) hydrocarbon concentration parameters (including saturation of gaseous species) in all phases of the water column.  Does not include parameters expressed per unit weight of SPM.
Parameters related to the reproduction of true seals (Phocidae), eared seals (Otariidae) and walruses (Odobenidae).
Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to kill other life forms in either whole organisms or their constituent parts.

prefLabel: Bacteria non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
definition: Basically any bacteria carbon biomass parameters that aren't included in parameter group BATC because they cannot be mapped to specific taxa in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  Bacteria are defined as Kingdom Monera, which includes cyanobacteria.

prefLabel: Electrical conductivity of the water column
definition: Parameters quantifying the flow of electrical current through or the electrical resistance of a body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere

prefLabel: Organosulphur and organoselenium species concentration parameters in water bodies
definition: All organosulphur and organoselenium compound concentration parameters (including saturations for gaseous species) in all phases of any body of fresh or salt water.
Measured or stratigraphically estimated age of ice

prefLabel: Organic sulphur compound dynamics in the water column
definition: Parameters relating to the rates of creation and consumption of organic sulphur compounds (such as DMS and carbonyl sulphide) in the water column
Measurements of optical visibility in the water column

prefLabel: Particulate total and organic phosphorus concentrations in the water column
definition: Concentrations of total and organic phosphorus in the particulate phase of the water column, which is a function of both the SPM concentration in the water column and the concentration of phosphorus per unit weight of SPM.

prefLabel: Sedimentation flux of metallic and metalloid elements and isotopes in water bodies
definition: Parameters quantifying metal and metalloid fluxes as element concentration or isotope activities per unit area per unit time

prefLabel: Skin temperature of the water column
definition: Temperature of the water column surface as measured by a radiometer.  It does NOT include temperature measurements in the upper few metres of the water column such as thermosalinograph data

prefLabel: Microzooplankton non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
definition: Basically, any microzooplankton carbon biomass measurement that isn't included in parameter group MATC.  May include data integrations such as 'total microzooplankton'.

prefLabel: Zooplankton taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
definition: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) carbon biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.
Parameters relating to the extent of light penetration into the water column

prefLabel: Partial pressure (pCO2) and fugacity (fCO2) of carbon dioxide in the water column
Transmittance and attenuance of the water column
definition: Parameters relating to the rate of electromagnetic radiation intensity decrease as it travels through the water column

prefLabel: Concentration of suspended particulate material in the water column
definition: Parameters quantifying SPM concentration in the water column by weight, by volume or in terms of turbidity

prefLabel: Particulate total and organic nitrogen concentrations in the water column
definition: Concentrations of total and organic nitrogen in the particulate phase of the water column, which is a function of both the SPM concentration in the water column and the concentration of nitrogen per unit weight of SPM. Note that it is commonly assumed that all particulate nitrogen is organic.
Bucket group for parameters that cannot be classified elsewhere

prefLabel: Dissolved organic carbon concentration in the water column
definition: DOC per unit volume of the water column.  Note that this includes some parameters that are strictly defined as total carbon, because the water was unfiltered on the assumption that POC was negligible.
Parameters quantifying the upward and downward motion of objects mounting sensors or collecting samples.
Parameters quantifying the uptake rate of nitrate or gaseous nitrogen by flora and fauna living in any body of salt or fresh water

Parameters specifying the physical dimensions of the particles comprising unlithified sediment (including expressions of shape such as aspect ratio) and statistics derived from their variation in a sample (e.g. mean, mode, sorting, skewness).

prefLabel: Sound velocity and travel time in the water column

definition: Direct measurements (including visual estimates) plus statistically derived parameters
Depth of the water column or elevation of land surface relative to sea surface, geoid or other datum

prefLabel: Vertical velocity of the water column (currents)
definition: Vertical water movement parameters including non-directional speeds
Temperature parameters in any body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere excluding the top few microns sampled by radiometers known as the skin
Fluxes of chemical species from the atmosphere to sea or land surface including precipitation and aerosol deposition but excluding fluxes due to exchange of gases

prefLabel: Phytoplankton taxonomic biomass in water bodies
definition: Any parameterisation of biomass (e.g. wet weight, dry weight, carbon, nitrogen etc.) of free-floating autotrophic biological entities identified by their taxonomic names (e.g. family, genus, species) in any body of fresh or salt water.

Parameters related to the volume of water passing through a point in a river system per unit time, including the rates of freshwater, dissolved material and particulate load discharge from a river into the sea.
Parameters relating to land (including marshes and the intertidal zone) vegetation

prefLabel: Temperature variation in the water column
definition: Parameters expressing the variation of temperature in the water column either as a function of space or of time

prefLabel: Ammonium and ammonia concentration parameters in water bodies
definition: Ammonium and ammonia concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in any body of fresh or salt water.

Includes all parameters covering the strength of emitted microwave radiation return, including absolute measurements of returning signal strength as well as parameters expressed as backscatter (the proportion of transmitted signal returned)
Parameters relating to atmospheric clarity, such as optical transmittance/attenuance, and resultant visibility

prefLabel: Concentrations of carboxylic acids and carboxylates in the atmosphere
definition: Parameters quantifying the concentration of acids containing a carboxyl (-C(=O)OH) group, their anions or their salts in any phase of the atmosphere

prefLabel: Phytoplankton generic biomass in water bodies
definition: Any parameterisation of biomass (e.g. wet weight, dry weight, carbon, nitrogen etc.) of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. microphytoplankton, ciliate, flagellate) in any body of fresh or salt water.

prefLabel: Total metal concentrations in water bodies
definition: Concentration parameters for metal elements in the combined dissolved and particulate phases of any body of fresh or salt water.
Parameters that describe the displacement of platforms or instruments in space relative to various origins

prefLabel: Sedimentation flux of carbon, nitrogen or organic matter in the water column
definition: Fluxes of particulate total, organic and inorganic carbon (including as CaCO3) and nitrogen (often measured as 'total' but assumed to be 'organic'). Organic matter is defined as matter lost on ignition.

prefLabel: Dissolved inorganic nitrogen concentration in the water column
definition: Total concentration of all dissolved inorganic nitrogen species in the water column, usually derived by summation of individual nutrient concentrations (NO3+NO2+NH4). Some workers may also include urea.
Parameters describing the nature and intensity of light generated by biological activity in the water column.

prefLabel: Zooplankton non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
definition: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) carbon biomass per unit volume parameters not included in group ZCTC.  Usually used for generic names such as 'mesozooplankton'.

prefLabel: Sedimentation flux of non-metallic inorganic species in the water column
definition: Quantity of any inorganic species such as silicon (opal) and phosphorus passing through unit area of the water column in unit time. Carbon and nitrogen are regarded as organic and explicitly excluded

prefLabel: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in the atmosphere
definition: Parameters quantifying polychlorobiphenyl (PCB) concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere

prefLabel: Chlorofluorocarbon concentrations in the water column
definition: Concentrations of chlorofluorocarbons (also known as freons or CFCs) in sny body of water

prefLabel: Alkalinity, acidity and pH of the water column
definition: Parameters quantifying the hydrogen ion concentration in water bodies

prefLabel: Light absorption in the water column
definition: Water column spectral absorption parameters

prefLabel: Nitrite concentration parameters in the water column
definition: Nitrite concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column
Parameters for directional and non-directional spectral wave data, excluding wave directions derived from spectral data.

prefLabel: Phosphate concentration parameters in the water column
definition: Phosphate  concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column

prefLabel: Gas fluxes between the water column and the atmosphere
definition: Parameters related to the quantification of fluxes of any gaseous species from water column to atmosphere including parameters characterising closely related processes such as bubble formation in the surface layer.
Measurements of wave height that are not based on the statistical analysis of wave records, such as heave, surface roughness and visual height estimates

prefLabel: Dissolved oxygen parameters in the water column
